thread.title: It's Touchdown Time at Four Seasons Hotel AustinTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: It's Touchdown Time at Four Seasons Hotel AustinTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: It's Touchdown Time at Four Seasons Hotel AustinTravelandtourworld.com
text:
It’s Touchdown Time at Four Seasons Hotel Austin Published on : Friday, September 4, 2015
With the first University of Texas football game of the 2015 season kicking off September 5, 2015, Four SeasonsHotel Austin is going on the offensive to provide an entire lineup of Longhorn-themed activities and amenities for guests.
For most fans, game day starts long before kick-off and the same holds true at Four Seasons. Below are just a few of the ways the Hotel is ready to get guests into a football frame of mind, from check-in to check-out:
Burnt orange floral displays in the Lobby, created just for the occasion
Complimentary mini-footballs – emblazoned with the Four Seasons logo – for pint-sized fans
Football Pool on home game weekends, with great prizes for those who select the correct square
Custom welcome amenity personalised with each team’s logos and colours
Special staff spirit consisting of UT hats and lapel pins
Tailgating on the front drive before home games, complete with a pick-up truck filled with pom-poms, pendants, Four Seasons “hook ‘em” koozies and sno-cones; food trucks will also be on hand to fuel up fans before the game
Four new UT-themed cocktails in the Lobby Lounge, including the DKR (Rittenhouse Rye, rosemary lemonade, tarragon-black pepper honey water, Deep Ellum IPA), Bevo’s Treat (Tequila Cabeza, St-Germain, strawberries, lime juice, club soda), Bleed Orange (Triple sec, prosecco, mango puree, blood orange) and Longhorn Legacy (Bacardi, Grand Marnier, Peche, lemon juice, peach tea)
Complimentary game day drop-off shuttle to take the hassle out of hoofing it to the stadium
A pop-up shop in the Lobby selling sought-after UT gear
Face painting two hours before kick-off for kids and adults alike (please note: while complimentary, tips are accepted and will be donated to the Seton Shivers Cancer Center)
Games televised on the big screen in the Lobby Lounge
Source:-Four Seasons Hotel
